brief_summary.textblock:
This non-interventional, observational study evaluates the efficacy of Targinact with regard
      to pain relief in daily clinical practice in Belgium compared to the previous analgesic
      treatment.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Non-interventional, Observational Study for Targinact® Treatment in Patients With Severe Pain.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients are treated with Targinact® according to daily clinical practice and are monitored
      during 3 study visits. Parameters assessed are efficacy regarding pain relief, efficacy
      regarding bowel function, pain relief, use of analgesic rescue medication, bowel function,
      use of laxatives, safety of Targinact treatment, use of concomitant medication, patient
      satisfaction and quality of life.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:

        Patients who are to be included in the study, are those who meet all of the following
        criteria based on the SPC.

          1. Male or female patients at least 18 years, or older, with severe pain.

          2. Patients with documented history of severe pain treated with WHO step 1, step 2
             and/or 3 analgesics with insufficient pain relief and/or unacceptable side effects
             that require around-the-clock opioid therapy and are likely to benefit from WHO step
             3 opioid therapy for the duration of the study.

        Exclusion criteria are based on the SPC of Targinact®.

clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy, With Regard to Pain Relief, of Targinact® Treatment for Patients With Severe Pain Compared to Previous Analgesic Treatment; a Non-interventional Study.

oversight_info.authority: Belgium:Federaal Agentschap voor Geneesmiddelen en Gezondheidsproducten (FAGG)

primary_outcome.description: Efficacy will be evaluated by the physician (7 categories). For the analysis the ordinal scale will be reduced to a binary scale: responder or non-responder. A responder is defined as a patient responding ''slightly better'',  ''better'' or ''much better'' at any time during the Targinact®therapy.  A non-responder is defined as a patient responding "same", "slightly worse", "worse", "much worse".
primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate  the efficacy of Targinact® treatment, with regard to pain relief, in patients with severe pain

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The relative changes from baseline at each visit will be used to compare the NAS pain scores during the Targinact® therapy.
secondary_outcome.measure: Pain NAS score (0-10) will be measured at each visit

secondary_outcome.description: The Bowel Function Index is the mean value of the 3 single items included in the BFI:1/ Difficulty of bowel movement (0 to 100; 0 = easy/no difficulty, 100 = severe difficulty); 2/ Feeling of incomplete bowel evacuation (0 to 100; 0 = not at all, 100 = very strong); 3/ Judgement of constipation (0 to 100; 0 = not at all, 100 = very strong).
secondary_outcome.measure: Bowel Function Index (BFI) will be recorded  at each visit

secondary_outcome.description: If laxative is used, the physician will document if it's used 1/ continuously, 2/ intermittently or 3/ rarely.
secondary_outcome.measure: The use of laxative medication (yes/no) per 24 hours will be recorded in the e-CRF
The use of analgesic  rescue medication (yes/no) used per day (24 hours) will be recorded

secondary_outcome.description: For the analysis the ordinal scale will be reduced to a binary scale: responder or non-responder. A responder is defined as a patient responding ''slightly better'',  ''better'' or ''much better'' at any time during the Targinact® therapy.  A non-responder is defined as a patient responding "same", "slightly worse", "worse", "much worse".
secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of Targinact® treatment, with regard to bowel function, will be evaluated by the physician (7 categories)

secondary_outcome.description: much worse, worse, slightly worse, same, slightly better, better, much better.
secondary_outcome.measure: The patient satisfaction will be evaluated by patient in 7 categories
The patient's quality of life will be evaluated via the EQ-5D questionnaire

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
